newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: PCI says unaware of reason for unusual trading volume.
newsitem.headline: PCI says unaware of reason for unusual trading volume.

text.p: Printed circuitboard maker PCI Ltd said on Wednesday it was not aware of any reason for the unusual trading volume in its shares on Tuesday and Wednesday.

It said in a statement to the Stock Exchange of Singapore that its two main substantial shareholders, Chuan Hup Holdings Ltd and P T Citra Perdana Abadi had also said they were also not aware of the unusual trading activity.
A total of 2.1 million PCI shares were crossed off-market at 81 Singapore cents on Wednesday morning, following a similar cross on Tuesday of just over two million shares at 80 cents.
PCI shares closed up one cent at 86.5 cents on turnover of 3.39 million lots on Wednesday.
